Requirement Description: Alexandria CPU cores shall implement all mandatory extensions as defined by the RVA23 profile. (RVA23U64/RVA23S64 extensions)
Alexandria CPU cores shall implement writable mtvec (mask = 0xxfffffffffffffffd)
Alexandria CPU cores shall implement writable misa (mask = 0x341029)
Alexandria CPU cores shall implement smnpm extension
Alexandria CPU cores shall implement smmpm extension
Alexandria CPU cores shall implement smstaten extension
Alexandria CPU cores shall implement xttzvqdot extension
Alexandria CPU cores shall fetch, decode and execute multiple instructions per clock cycle
Alexandria CPU cores shall support out-of-order execution with register renaming and speculative execution.
Alexandria CPU cores shall support advanced branch prediction.
Alexandria CPU cores shall have private L1 Instruction and Data cache
Alexandria clusters shall have shared L2 cache
Alexandria cluster L2 cache shall be NINE of the L1 cache
Alexandria CPU cores shall support Sv39, Sv48 and Sv57 virtual memory with TLBs
Alexandria CPU cores shall implement weak memory ordering model adhering to the RISC-V memory consistency model. (RVWMO)
Alexandria cluster L2 cache shall support L2 IO coherence.
Alexandria CPU cores shall implement cache coherence mechanisms for multi-core configurations.
Alexandria shall support Cache-line lock-out on L1 private cache for each core, L2 TLB for each core and shared cache for the cluster.
Alexandria CPU cores shall implement a vector processing unit supporting the RISC-V Vector (V) extension.
Alexandria CPU cores shall implement the RISC-V Advanced Interrupt Architecture (AIA) specification.
Notes: smaia, ssaia only. MSI shall be supported.

Requirement Description: Alexandria CPU shall support 255 interrupt identifiers for M-mode interrupt file and S-mode interrupt file.
Alexandria CPU shall support 5 Guest Supervisor Interrupt files and each interrupt file supports 63 interrupt identifiers
Alexandria CPU shall implement Resumable non-maskable interrupt (NMRI) smrnmi as non-maskable interrupt.
Alexandria CPU cores shall implement Resumable non-maskable interrupt (NMRI) smrnmi instead of NMI
Alexandria CPU shall support 5 Guest Supervisor Interrupt files
Alexandria CPU cores shall support the JTAG interface for debugging.
Alexandria CPU cores shall support N-Trace.
Notes: Trace encoder, trace funnel, Trace Sink

Requirement Description: Alexandria CPU cores shall implement instruction tracing and perfromance monitoring units capturing events as defined in section 9.4 of the ascalon_arch.pdf
Alexandria shall support clock monitoring on each core
Alexandria shall support temperature monitoring
Alexandria shall support code profiling
Alexandria CPU cores shall support Machine, Hypervisor and Supervisor priveledge modes.
Alexandria shall implement front-end security to mitigate against speculative side channel attacks.
Alexandria CPU cores shall implement physical memory protection (PMP)
Alexandria CPU cores shall support an interface for secure boot process.
Alexandria CPU cores shall support Static Trusted Execution Environment (STEE)
Notes: MVP: Support trustzone equivalent featuresÂ

Requirement Description: Alexandria CPU cores shall implement Reliability, Availability and Serviceability (RAS) to comply with the RISC-V RAS specification.
Notes: RAS is fully supported on Asc and this support will carry over into ALX. Additionally, ALX will update RAS logging descriptors & use the RAS RERI interface to indicate FuSa failures.

Requirement Description: Alexandria shall support Design for Testability (DFT)
Alexandria shall allow for 3rd party DFT implementations.
Alexandria shall allow for 3rd party BIST implementations.
Alexandria CPU cores shall implement ssqosid Quality of Service identifiers.
Alexandria CPU cores shall implement cbqti RISC-V Capacity and Bandwidth QoS regiser interface
Alexandria clusters shall support both Coherent and Non-Coherent combination of clusters by use of CHI.E and AXI-5 Lite interfaces.
Notes: Does this need to be limited to 32 cores? i.e. (4 clusters of 8 cores) or (8 clusters of 4 cores).

Requirement Description: Alexandria clusters shall support Cluster Internal Network.
Alexandria clusters shall support N-Trace trace unit.
Alexandria clusters shall support Debug Unit, JTAG Debug Transport Module (DTM) and Debug Module (DM)
Alexandria shall implement Cluster Power Management Logic (CPL)
Alexandria shall support a multi-core configuration (cluster) of 2 CPUs with 4MB L2 shared cache
Alexandria shall support a multi-core configuration (cluster) of 4 CPUs with 4MB L2 shared cache
Alexandria shall support a multi-core configuration (cluster) of 8 CPUs with 12MB L2 shared cache
Alexandria clusters shall support Reset, Clock, Memory, RAS Error INT, Cluster ID pins and Debug interfaces.
Alexandria CPU subsystem L2 shared cache sizes of 2MB, 4MB, 8MB and 12MB shall be build-time configurable
An Alexandria Software Development Kit (SDK) shall be produced.
Secure boot process flow and assets shall be provided witihin the Alexandria SDK
All necessary drivers for Alexandria core and cluster components shall be provided within the Alexandria BSP.
Alexandria shall support automotive grade Linux (AGL) wrt architectural components
Alexandria shall support QNX wrt architectural components
Alexandria shall support Android Auto wrt architectural components
Alexandria HAL shall implement platform-abstraction APIs for peripherals, CSR access, timer, PLIC, and CLINT, adhering to RVA23 CSR layout.
Alexandria boot & startup code shall implement safe, deterministic power-on and warm-restart routines; early self-tests and hardware diagnostics.
Alexandria safety self-tests shall implement CPU register, PC, ALU, FPU, and memory BISTs (LBIST/MBIST integration hooks).
Alexandria safety library shall implement pre-certified (or certifiable) math, memory, and control libraries with fault detection mechanisms.
Alexandria shall support safety RTOS (SafeRTOS, Zephyr with Safety Extension, or AUTOSAR OS); task isolation and watchdog integration.
Alexandria memory protection shall implement PMP abstraction layer for isolation and fault containment.
Alexandria software interrupt architecture shall implement a configurable interrupt handler framework supporting CLINT and APLIC with nesting, masking, and determinism.
Alexandria software diagnostoic framework shall implement APIs for runtime diagnostics, including end-to-end communication tests, CRCs, heartbeat monitors, etc.
Alexandria software logging and traceability shall implement structured logging for safety events, with optional trace instrumentation points.
Alexandria software configuration shall implement a YAML/JSON-based configuration layer for soft IP integration, allowing adaptation to different system instances.
Alexandria software shall implement RV32I Base Integer ISAâ Required, for compiling and running C code
Alexandria software shall implement M-extension (for `mul`, `div`, etc.) Required for full compiler math support
Alexandria software shall implement Zicsr Required for CSR manipulation (e.g., `mstatus`, `mie`) from software
Alexandria software shall implement Zifencei Required to ensure software can manage instruction cache coherency
Alexandria software shall support Machine mode (M-mode) Base requirement for bare-metal and RTOS software
Alexandria software shall support trap/interrupt handling in M-mode Required to write handlers in C/assembly
Alexandria software shall support atomic word access (AMO swap, compare-and-swap) Required for software synchronization
Alexandria software shall support for misaligned memory access handling via trap Ensures compliant compiler behavior
Alexandria software shall be compatible with GCC and LLVM RISC-V toolchains
Alexandria software shall be compatible with `newlib` or other lightweight C runtime libraries
Alexandria software shall support interrupt and timer handler software
Alexandria software shall be testable with RISCOF/ISA validation software
Alexandria software shall expose debug-visible state (PC, privilege level) to firmware/software tools
Alexandria software shall include a programmer manual (CSR list, trap behavior, privilege details)
Alexandria software shall provide software examples and toolchain integration guide
Alexandria clusters shall support a build time configurable operating mode of SPLIT, HYBRID or LOCK mode, exclusive.
Notes: By default, Hybrid mode will have lock-step non-core logic to help entire cluster meet ASIL B, however, to improve PPA, it is preferred not to lock-step the entire non-core portion as much as we canÂ

Requirement Description: Alexandria clusters shall support a boot-time configurable operating mode of SPLIT, HYBRID or LOCK mode, exclusive.
Alexandria clusters shall support RAS error reporting registers on all components employing SRAM complying with the RERI specification.
Alexandria shall support fault injection mechanisms to enable testing of hardware safety features.
Notes: Any protected SRAM memories

Requirement Description: Alexandria shall support real-time hardware safety monitors to detect and respond to CPU faults.
Alexandria shall have a separate physical bus for configuring and reporting safety relevant information
Alexandria shall support a silicon lifecycle managment (SLM) APB and IEEE-1687 IJTAG interface. (industry trend to include as IP 'bundle') Checking with Ian.
Alexandria clusters shall support SPLIT mode
Notes: Each core and non-core logic operates independently and there is no hardware support for diagnostics in shared resources

Requirement Description: Alexandria clusters shall support HYBRID mode
Notes: Each core operates independently and non-core logic operates in time-shifted lockstep and there are hardware diagnostic mechanisms for shared resources.

Requirement Description: Alexandria shall include RTL Built-In Self-Test (BIST) capabilities for logic and memory components to support manufacturing test and in-field diagnostics as well as FuSa compliance.
Alexandria shall implement a fault management unit for detecting, handling and reporting faults and exceptions.
Alexandria clusters shall support LOCK mode
Notes: Pairs of cores and non-core logic operate in time-shifted lockstep and there are hardware diagnostic mechanisms for shared resources

Requirement Description: Alexandria shall fulfill systematic processes
Alexandria shall implement bus Interface protection enabled
Alexandria shall implement memory protection for all memories (cache, register files, etc.)
Alexandria shall support the ability for individual CPU cores to have run-time LBIST (request from Denso) Check on actual customer need & expectations Chceking with Ian
Notes: check with Sam/Ian

Requirement Description: Alexandria software hall achieve ASIL-B in HYBRID mode with use of STLs
Alexandria STLs shall provide API response code.
Alexandria STLs shall not interfere with system application software.
Alexandria STLs shall be configurable for different SoC designs.
Alexandria STLs shall detect a fault within TBD DTTI.
Alexandria STLs shall be interruptable.
Alexandria STLs shall when resuming from an interrupt, restore to fail-safe checkpoint within TBD latency (Wei-ren to clarrify)
Alexandria STLs shall be portable for future Ascalon uArch products.
Alexandria STLs shall provide comprehensive boot-time diagnostics.
Alexandria boot-time STL diagnostics may be destructive.
Alexandria STLs shall provide non-destructive run-time diagnostics.
The RISC-V Compiler and toolchain for Alexandria shall be qualified to meet ASIL D requirements
Alexandria STLs shall operate within ___ cycle and provide sufficient coverages with other hardware safety mechanismsÂ
Notes: Benchmark that captures cycles? should not exceed X% of Benchmark cycle? Capture as percentage impact of STL operating?

Requirement Description: STLs for achieving ASIL-B (if applicable) shall have less than a 5% performance impact to SPEC and Dhrystone benchmark targets.
All Alexandria firmware & software components shall be developed to meet ASIL-D requirements.
Alexandria shall support a build-time configuration to restrict Double Precision Floating Point results to 4 per cycle to comply with Export Control
Notes: https://tenstorrent.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/RVRTLDV/pages/417136699

Requirement Description: Alexandria shall support a build-time configuration to remove all cryptography capabilities to comply with Export Control
Alexandria shall achieve at least 25.27 Dmips / Mhz Dhrystone
Notes: MVP: 25.27 Dmips/MHz

Requirement Description: Alexandria CPU core shall achieve at least 20 SPECint2006 / GHz, base score (single core)
Notes: MVP: >18.2 /GHz SpecINT2k6 without software optimization ASC = 20.44 as of 4/25

Requirement Description: Alexandria CPU core shall achieve at least 22 SPECint2006 / GHz, peak score (single core)
Notes: MVP: >20/GHz. ASC = 22 as of 4/25

Requirement Description: Alexandria clusters shall achieve SPECint_rate 2006 / GHz peak score within 5% linenarly scaled per core count (multi-core)
Notes: Shall be within 5% of linear scaling

Requirement Description: Alexandria CPU core shall achieve at least 2.1 SPECint2017 / GHz (single core)
Alexandria CPU core shall run at an Fmax minimun of 2.25 GHz sustained frequency in TSMC N3A Vdd = Vnom - 10%, SS, -40C to 125C Tj, Ta max = 105C
Notes: shall meet timing closure at 2.3 GHz at -40C to 125C Tj, SS< Vdd = Vnom - 10%V (0.675 N3A). Meera - 2 GHz at N3A

Requirement Description: Alexandria clusters shall have less than a 20% SPEC score degradation as compared to single core performance.
Alexandria Fmax should be greater than 2.375 GHz on SF4X
Notes: Shall be within 3-5% of Ascalon D8 under same technology node

Requirement Description: Alexandria Static Power (including leakage) shall be less than 1.69 W (Dhrystone), 3.4 W (Virus) for 1 CPU core + 1/8 SC
Notes: P0: +3% reduction compared to Ascalon D8

Requirement Description: Alexandria Dynamic Power shall be less than 0.51/GHz (Dhrystone) and 0.95W/GHz (Virus) for 1 CPU core + 1/8 SC
Alexandria Static Power (including leakage) should be less than 1.2W (Dhrystone), 2.1W (Virus) for 1 CPU core + 1/8 SC
Notes: P1: -20% reduction compared to Ascalon D8

Requirement Description: Alexandria Dyhamic Power should be less than 0.40 W/GHz (Dhrystone) and 0.75W/GHz (Virus) for 1 CPU core + 1/8 SC
Alexandria single core shall have an area of less than 1.39 mm2 @N3A
Notes: P0: 4% increase compared to Ascalon D8 - Core is expected to increase due to FuSa components

Requirement Description: Alexandria single core shall have an area of less than 1.07 mm2 @N3A
Notes: P1: -20% reduction compared to Ascalon D8

Requirement Description: Alexandria shall target a utilization rate to a minimum of 65% for core and cluster
Alexandria shall use the target process node for SOP of TSMC N3A
Alexandria shall use the target process node for SOP of TSMC N5A
Notes: Scaled

Requirement Description: Alexandria may use the target process node for SOP of TSMC N4
Alexandria may use the target process node for SOP of TSMC N7A
Alexandria shall have a unit-level test of at minimun the 4-core cluster
Notes: Alexandria shall be available for General Access (GA) deployment no later than TBD, 2026

Requirement Description: Alexandria shall have a emulator reference flow in Zebu
Alexandria shall have a prototyping reference flow in HAPs
Alexandria shall be rigorously verified using formal and simulation.
Alexandria shall use ISO 26262 compliant verification process.
Alexandria shall leverage UVM-based verification envoronment.
Alexandria documentation shall be made avaialble to end-user
Notes: Check with Sai

Requirement Description: Alexandria shall be fully synthesizable RTL soft IP
Notes: See IPPROD-343 for complete list

Requirement Description: Verification testbench and test cases shall be made available to end-user
Notes: What testbenches and test caese?

Requirement Description: Synthesis scripts and timing constraints shall be made available to end-user
Notes: Which vendor?

Requirement Description: Software Development Kit (SDK) and toolchain shall be made available to end-user
ISO 26262 Compliance reports shall be be made available to end-user
Safety analysis reports (FMEDA, DFA) shall be be made available to end-user

Notes: Additional Security Deliverables?

Requirement Description: Alexandria shall be developed with AEC-Q100 Grade 2 qualification process as applicable to soft IP (Reliability)
Notes: Applicable as needed

Requirement Description: Alexandria shall be available for Beta deployment no later than Oct. 30, 2025
Alexandria shall be available for Limited Access (LA) deployment no later than Jan. 30, 2026
Alexandria shall be available for Early Access (EA) deployment no later than March 30, 2026
Alexandria shall be available for General Access (GA) deployment no later than TBD, 2026
